pasta.repository

Class AssessmentDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • pasta.repository.AssessmentDAO

  • @Repository(value="assessmentDAO")
public class AssessmentDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    Data Access Object for Assessments.

    This class is responsible for all of the interaction between the data layer (disk in this case) and the system for assessments. This includes writing the assessment properties to disk and loading the assessment properties from disk when the system starts. It also handles all of the changes to the objects and holds them cached. There should only be one instance of this object running in the system at any time.

    Since:
    2012-11-13
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Alex Radu

      • removeAssessment

        public void removeAssessment(java.lang.String assessmentName)
        Delete an assessment from the system.

        Iterates over all competitions and removes itself from them. Competitions are the only assessment modules that contain a link to the assessments they are used in.

        Parameters:
        assessmentName - the short name (no spaces) of the assessment

      • getUnitTestFromDisk

        private UnitTest getUnitTestFromDisk(java.lang.String location)
        Method to get a unit test from a location.

        Loads the unitTestProperties.xml from file into the cache.

        Parameters:
        location - - the location of the unit test
        Returns:
        null - there is no unit test at that location to be retrieved

      • getHandMarkingFromDisk

        private HandMarking getHandMarkingFromDisk(java.lang.String location)
        Method to get a handmarking from a location

        Loads the handMarkingProperties.xml from file into the cache. Also loads the multiple .html files which are the descriptions in each box of the hand marking template.

        Parameters:
        location - - the location of the handmarking
        Returns:
        null - there is no handmarking at that location to be retrieved

      • updateHandMarking

        public void updateHandMarking(HandMarking newHandMarking)
        Update a hand marking template

        Updates cache and writes everything to file. Pretty much used all the time, because when you make a new hand marking template, you generate one based on defaults.

        Parameters:
        newHandMarking - the new hand marking template

      • newHandMarking

        public void newHandMarking(NewHandMarking newHandMarking)
        Creates a default hand marking template. Default columns are:
        • Poor : 0%
        • Acceptable : 50%
        • Excellent : 100%
        Default rows are:
        • Formatting : 20%
        • Code Reuse : 40%
        • Variable naming : 40%
        Default descriptions are empty.
        Parameters:
        newHandMarking - the new hand marking

      • writeArenaToDisk

        public void writeArenaToDisk(Arena arena,
                    Competition comp)
        Write an arena to disk
        Parameters:
        arena - the arena getting written to disk
        comp - the comp the arena belongs to

      • updatePlayerInArena

        public void updatePlayerInArena(Competition comp,
                       Arena arena,
                       java.lang.String username,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> players)
        Update the players taking part in an arena

        Updates in both cache and disk. If the set players is empty, all players for this user are removed. The players are stored as $username$.players files where the name of each player is on a separate line within $compLocation$/arenas/$arenaName/players/ This was done to ensure there were limited concurrency problems. This could obviously be moved onto the database but I didn't want to at the time because I wanted to limit the reliance on a database.

        Parameters:
        comp - the competition
        arena - the arena
        username - the name of the user updating which of their players are participating in the arena.
        players - the set of players, if empty, all players will be removed.
